services.name: AI-Powered Embryo Grading System
services.overview: This service provides an automated embryo quality assessment tool using advanced computer vision techniques. It addresses the inherent subjectivity and variability in manual embryo grading, which often leads to inconsistencies in IVF success rates. The system analyzes microscope images of embryos, predicting their implantation potential with higher accuracy than traditional human grading methods. By leveraging a vast, pre-trained dataset of embryo images, the AI algorithm identifies subtle morphological features that correlate with successful implantation. The system integrates seamlessly into existing IVF lab workflows, allowing embryologists to upload images and receive instant viability rankings. This allows embryologists to prioritize the selection of embryos with the highest potential for transfer, optimizing IVF outcomes and reducing overall lab costs. The system aims to standardize and enhance the embryo selection process, improving patient satisfaction and increasing the efficiency of IVF clinics.
problems_addressed: Subjectivity in manual embryo grading leading to inconsistent results.
Variability in embryologist experience affecting grading accuracy.
Time-consuming nature of manual embryo assessment, impacting lab efficiency.
Difficulty in identifying subtle morphological features indicative of embryo viability.
Lowered IVF success rates due to suboptimal embryo selection.
target_users: IVF clinic directors and lab managers
core_features: Automated Embryo Image Analysis – AI-powered analysis of microscope images to assess embryo quality.
Implantation Potential Prediction – Prediction of embryo viability based on morphological features and AI modeling.
Real-time Ranking and Scoring – Instant ranking and scoring of embryos based on predicted implantation potential, displayed in an easy-to-interpret interface.
Secure Image Upload and Storage – Secure and HIPAA-compliant image upload and storage within the system.
Detailed Reporting and Analytics – Generation of comprehensive reports on embryo quality metrics and grading history.
Integration with Existing Lab Systems – Seamless integration with existing Electronic Medical Records (EMR) and Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS).
Customizable Grading Parameters – Ability to adjust AI grading parameters to align with specific clinic protocols and research findings.
User Authentication and Access Control – Secure user authentication with role-based access control to protect sensitive patient data.
user_journeys: An embryologist logs into the system using secure credentials. They upload microscope images of embryos obtained during an IVF cycle. The AI algorithm analyzes the images and generates a viability score for each embryo. The system ranks the embryos from highest to lowest potential for implantation, highlighting key morphological features. The embryologist reviews the AI-generated rankings and uses the data to inform their embryo selection decisions, prioritizing the transfer of embryos with the highest predicted viability. The embryologist documents the selection process and transfers the chosen embryo(s) to the patient. The system generates a report summarizing the grading results and embryo selection rationale, which is stored securely within the patient's record.
ai_capabilities: Computer Vision for Image Analysis – Utilizes convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to analyze embryo images and extract relevant morphological features.
Machine Learning for Viability Prediction – Employs a classification model trained on a large dataset of embryo images and corresponding implantation outcomes to predict embryo viability.
Ensemble Modeling – Combines multiple AI models to improve prediction accuracy and robustness.
Anomaly Detection – Identifies embryos with unusual or potentially problematic morphological characteristics.
Model Training and Fine-tuning – Allows for continuous model improvement through retraining on new data and fine-tuning to specific clinic populations.

input_data_types: Microscope images of embryos (JPEG, PNG, TIFF)
data_schema_recommendations: Embryo Table: embryo_id (UUID), patient_id (UUID), image_url (VARCHAR), development_stage (ENUM ['Day 3', 'Day 5']), fertilization_method (ENUM ['IVF', 'ICSI']), ai_viability_score (FLOAT), embryologist_grade (VARCHAR), implantation_outcome (BOOLEAN), upload_timestamp (TIMESTAMP).
Images stored on Supabase storage or AWS S3 with URLs in the Embryo Table.
data_sources: Third-party embryo image datasets (with appropriate ethical approvals)
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: HIPAA compliance is critical.  All data must be encrypted at rest and in transit.  Implement strict access controls and audit logs.  Obtain informed consent from patients for the use of their embryo images in AI training and analysis.  Adhere to relevant data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR if applicable).

required_integrations: Electronic Medical Records (EMR) systems (e.g., Epic, Cerner)
Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) (e.g., LabWare, STARLIMS)
Microscope imaging systems (direct API or file system integration)
Billing and payment gateways (for subscription management)
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: OAuth 2.0 or JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for secure API access. Recommend Clerk or Auth0 for user management and authentication. Implement multi-factor authentication (MFA) for enhanced security.

technical_specifications.architecture: The system will adopt a microservices architecture with a frontend web application, a backend API layer, a database for storing embryo data and AI model results, and an AI pipeline for image analysis and viability prediction. The AI pipeline will be designed for scalability and efficient processing of large volumes of embryo images.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes defined above
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob
recommended_tech_stack.AI: Python (for AI model development), TensorFlow/PyTorch, OpenAI API (for embeddings or feature extraction if needed), Vector DB (Pinecone/Supabase vectors) for similarity search of embryo images.
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: RESTful API for communication between frontend and backend.

API_design: /embryos (POST): Upload embryo images for analysis. Payload: {patient_id: UUID, images: [base64 encoded image strings], development_stage: STRING}
/embryos/{embryo_id} (GET): Retrieve embryo grading results. Response: {embryo_id: UUID, viability_score: FLOAT, ranking: INTEGER, morphological_features: JSON}
/patients/{patient_id}/embryos (GET): Retrieve all embryos for a patient. Response: [{embryo_id: UUID, viability_score: FLOAT, ranking: INTEGER}, ...]
/admin/users (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE): Manage user accounts.
frontend_components: Image Uploader: Component for uploading microscope images of embryos.
Embryo List: Displays a list of embryos with their viability scores and rankings.
Embryo Details: Shows detailed information about an embryo, including morphological features identified by the AI.
Patient Search: Allows users to search for patients and their associated embryos.
Reporting Dashboard: Provides an overview of embryo grading statistics and performance metrics.

deployment_instructions: Directory structure: /frontend (Next.js app), /backend (Node.js API), /ai_models (Python scripts for AI model training and inference).
Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DATABASE_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, AUTH0_CLIENT_ID, AUTH0_CLIENT_SECRET.
Vercel deployment: Configure Vercel to automatically deploy the frontend and backend from the GitHub repository. Set up environment variables in Vercel.
Build outputs: Next.js application needs to be built using 'next build'. Backend API should be deployed as serverless functions.
AI model deployment: Containerize the AI model inference service using Docker and deploy it to a cloud platform like AWS ECS or Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) or use serverless functions on Vercel.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers based on the number of embryo analyses per month (e.g., Basic, Standard, Premium).
Usage-based pricing for additional analyses beyond the subscription limit.
Add-ons: Premium support, custom model training, integration services.

success_metrics: Operational KPIs: Number of active users, number of embryo analyses performed per month, system uptime, support ticket resolution time.
AI performance KPIs: AI model accuracy (precision, recall, F1-score), correlation between AI viability scores and implantation outcomes, reduction in embryologist grading variability.

Adoption/engagement KPIs: User satisfaction (measured through surveys), feature usage rates, customer retention rate, increased IVF success rates, reduction in lab costs (e.g., fewer failed IVF cycles).
